data.title: STEPHEN KING NOVELS
data.meta_description: Stephen Edwin King was born on September 21, 1947. He is an American author of horror, supernatural fiction, suspense, crime, science-fiction, and fantasy novels.
data.text:
Stephen King

Stephen Edwin King was born on September 21, 1947. He is an American author of horror, supernatural fiction, suspense, crime, science-fiction, and fantasy novels.

Credit : IMDb

The Stand

It centres on a devastating super virus named Captain Trips, responsible for wiping out nearly 99% of the world's population.

Credit : amazon

It

The novel 'It' revolves around a group of friends in Maine contending with a demented clown named Pennywise residing in the town's sewers.

Credit : amazon

Salemâ€™s Lot

The story is based on vampire that relocates to a small Maine town. The town succumbs to vampirism, a high school teacher and his girlfriend lead the counterattack.

Credit : amazon

The Shining

'The Shining' evolved, with King drawing upon his personal struggles with alcoholism to shape elements of the plot. Stanley Kubrick later adapted it into his film in 1980.

Credit : amazon

11/22/63

This novel centers on a divorced high school teacher who stumbles upon a portal to 1958 within a small diner. He takes a teaching job and prepares for the day of JFK's assassination .

Credit : amazon

The Dead Zone

It revolves around Johnny Smith, a schoolteacher who emerges from a coma with psychic abilities.

Credit : amazon
